DETAILS: this automatically generates unique names for your mothbox
if 'autoname' is False the mothbox will use the name you supply here
this must be an official timezone from the list of linux timezones (supplied in the neighboring file)
leave this as True and the mothbox will automatically set its own time

if the autoSystemTime is False the mothbox will get set to whatever value you put here ONE time and then disable manual time setting (to prevent Groundhog Days) until you set AutosystemTime to False again
put how long you want a photo session to go (in minutes). (make it not a full hour if you are doing things hourly)
specify what hour you want things to turn on in 24 timeframe separate multi values with a semicolon
specify a specific minute or you can replace the 'minute' key in the arguments dictionary with 'minute_period'
not currently used by the mothbox
this is the voltage of the battery when its about 80 percent full (This helps you calibrate the overal battery percent meter for different batteries)
this is the voltage of the battery when it is about 20 percent full
write an SSID of a wifi you want to add to the pi
write the wifi password (not currently implemented)
